content: I was thinking it would be nice to push some tags to rust-lang/llvm-project
these would be unofficial (not signed tags), just for information
it would let you query things like git branch -r rustc-1.45.2 to see what went with a release
(we can bikeshed the tag name, of course...)
I can quickly script that out, if this sounds useful
I went ahead and push tags out to my own forks, cuviper/llvm-project and cuviper/llvm

You can obtain such information with 1 extra level of indirection right now (by inspecting the submodule value at tag in rust-lang/rust) but if infrastructure doesn’t have any concerns with maintaining such infrastructure, then I don’t think we do either.
That's how I got the commits for my tags, something like git ls-tree 1.45.2:src/
I wasn't thinking about automated infrastructure, but of course that would be nicer
I (or whoever does releases) already tags rustc and cargo - I would be fine also tagging our LLVM repo. Just needs to be added to release process on forge
